intro: Senecio almagroi, commonly known as the Almagro groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
